name: Skjor

aspects.high_concept: Scarred Veteran of the Circle's Shadow War
aspects.trouble: The Beast Blood Is Strength, Not Sickness

stunts: Ambush Predator: +2 to Fight on the first exchange of a conflict if Skjor was hidden or unnoticed beforehand.
Old Wolf's Cunning: Once per session, Skjor may use Stealth in place of Deceive to set up a tactical misdirection.
Scarred Survivor: Skjor may ignore one mild consequence per session (he's taken worse and kept fighting).

trust_clock.description: Skjor's wary respect for the PC, built through proven strength and battle deeds despite ideological disagreement over the cure.

personality_notes.speaking_style: Blunt, rough, challenging. Speaks like someone who has seen too many battles to waste words on diplomacy.
motivations: Keep the Companions strong through strength, not sentiment
Embrace the beast blood as the gift Hircine intended
Protect the Circle's secrets at all costs
fears: The Companions going soft under gentle leadership
Losing the beast blood to a cure he never asked for
The Silver Hand finding and exploiting the Circle's weakness
quirks: Traces the scar over his blind eye when sizing someone up
Speaks of the beast blood the way a smith speaks of good steel — as a tool that defines the craftsman
Pushes recruits harder than anyone else and respects only those who push back

relationships.Kodlak Whitemane: Respects the Harbinger but disagrees about the cure; obeys out of loyalty, not conviction
relationships.Aela the Huntress: Close ally and kindred spirit; both embrace the beast blood fully
relationships.Farkas: Easy respect between two fighters who prefer action over talk
relationships.Vilkas: Mutual respect but ideological friction; Vilkas's brooding irritates Skjor
relationships.Elitrof Whitemane: Wary respect; the newcomer refused the blood but proved himself in battle

notes: Circle member. Skjor is hard-edged and pro-beast blood — he sees the lycanthropy as Hircine's gift and considers Kodlak's cure quest misguided, though he obeys the Harbinger's authority. He is alive in this campaign timeline. His stance on the cure is firmly against it, aligned with Aela.
combat_tactics: Skjor fights dirty by Companion standards — ambushes, flanking, striking from stealth. He is the Circle's shadow operative, comfortable in places where honor gets people killed. In werewolf form he is fast and vicious rather than powerful.
